Azure.Firewall.Mode.Name: Azure.Firewall.Mode
Azure.Firewall.Mode.DisplayName: Configure deny on threat intel for classic managed Azure Firewalls
Azure.Firewall.Mode.Synopsis: Deny high confidence malicious IP addresses and domains on classic managed Azure Firewalls.
Azure.Firewall.Mode.Recommendation: Consider configuring Azure Firewall to alert and deny IP addresses and domains detected as malicious. Alternatively, consider using firewall policies to manage Azure Firewalls at scale.

Azure.SQL.FirewallIPRange.Name: Azure.SQL.FirewallIPRange
Azure.SQL.FirewallIPRange.DisplayName: Limit SQL logical server firewall rule range
Azure.SQL.FirewallIPRange.Synopsis: Determine if there is an excessive number of permitted IP addresses.
Azure.SQL.FirewallIPRange.Recommendation: SQL Server has greater then ten (10) public IP addresses that are permitted network access. Some rules may not be needed or can be reduced.

Azure.ACR.Quarantine.Name: Azure.ACR.Quarantine
Azure.ACR.Quarantine.Synopsis: Enable container image quarantine, scan, and mark images as verified.
Azure.ACR.Quarantine.Recommendation: Consider configuring a security tool to implement the image quarantine pattern. Enable image quarantine on the container registry to ensure each image is verified before use.

Azure.VM.UniqueDns.Name: Azure.VM.UniqueDns
Azure.VM.UniqueDns.Synopsis: Network interfaces (NICs) should inherit DNS from virtual networks.
Azure.VM.UniqueDns.Recommendation: Consider updating NIC DNS server settings to inherit from virtual network.

Azure.PostgreSQL.FirewallRuleCount.Name: Azure.PostgreSQL.FirewallRuleCount
Azure.PostgreSQL.FirewallRuleCount.Synopsis: Determine if there is an excessive number of firewall rules.
Azure.PostgreSQL.FirewallRuleCount.Recommendation: The PostgreSQL server has greater then ten (10) firewall rules. Some rules may not be needed.

Azure.Template.ValidSecretRef.Name: Azure.Template.ValidSecretRef
Azure.Template.ValidSecretRef.Synopsis: Use a valid secret reference within parameter files.
